Speaker: david lynch
Dialogue: December 9, 1983 --

Speaker: irulan
Dialogue: Father. -- EMPEROR Irulan.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: A Third Stage Guild Navigator will be here within minutes!

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: We felt his presence.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: I shall want telepathy during his visit and a report when we're finished.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Their minds are so.... They move in strange directions....

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Forced spice evolution of humans changes many things.... I must sit close to him.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: He will not permit anyone but me to see him. You must be outside this room.... Do what you can.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: I am your Truthsayer, my lord...  He is here, my lord.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Leave us.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Yes, my Lord.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: We are alone...

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: We have just folded space from Ix...

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Yes?... How was your journey?

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: Many machines on Ix... new machines.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Oh yes? -- NAVIGATOR Better than those on Richesse.. You are transparent... I see many things... I see plans within plans.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Is there a problem?... Usually there is a problem when one of you makes a visit.

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: The answer is within the problem...

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: I see two Great Houses -- House Atreides, House Harkonnen -- feuding... I see you behind it.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: You must share with us. -- EMPEROR The Atreides house is building a secret army!... using a technique unknown to us... a technique involving sound. The Duke is becoming more popular in the Landsraad... he could threaten me.... I have ordered House Atreides to occupy Arrakis to mine the spice... thus replacing their enemies the Harkonnens.... House Atreides will not refuse because of the tremendous power they think they will gain. Then, at an appointed time Baron Harkonnen will return to Arrakis and launch a sneak attack on House Atreides... I have promised the Baron five legions of my Sardaukar terror troops.

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: So the Harkonnens will rid you of House Atreides...

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: Reverend Mother... I will give you the Tleilaxu Path.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Can you hear me?... If this visit has anything to do with spice... -- The Guild Navigator shudders and swishes quite violently in his tank.

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: LISTEN TO ME!! The spice must flow... the spice has given me accelerated evolution for four thousand years... it has enabled you to live two hundred years... the spice helps make the sapho juice, which gives the red-lipped mentats the ability to be living computers... the secret side of spice... the water of life.

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: ...gives the Bene Gesserit sisterhood the metaphysical ability to see beyond...to have superior powers... Our power to fold space is in the spice... Without us, your empire would be lost on isolated scattered planets... You would be lost.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: I can assure you...

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: Do not interrupt!!! Do not speak lightly of the spice... ONE SMALL POINT...

Speaker: navigator
Dialogue: We ourselves... foresee a slight problem within House Atreides.... Paul.... Paul Atreides.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: You mean, of course, Duke Leto Atreides... his father. -- Page missing --

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Here we are now... nineteen light years beyond...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: It does look dry....

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Where are the Harkonnens from here?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I know, Thufir, I'm sitting with my back to the door.

Speaker: thufir
Dialogue: Those sounds could be imitated.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I'd know the difference.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: My father sent you to test me. Music then?

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: No music. I'm packing this for the crossing. Shield practice.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Shield practice? Gurney... we had practice -- this morning..... I'm not in the mood.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Not in the mood?! Mood's a thing for cattle and love play... not fighting.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I'm sorry Gurney.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Not sorry enough.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Guard yourself for true!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What's gotten into Gurney? He's not faking. Paul presses forward and the fight moves quickly around the room. The smell of ozone grows stronger as the shields hit and SPARK off one another. Paul directs a parry downwards, turns, and leads Gurney against the table, plunging at just the right moment to pin Gurney against the table top with his blade right at Gurney's neck.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Is this what you seek?

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Good... the slow blade penetrates the shield... but look down.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Would you really have drawn my blood?

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: If you'd fought one whit below your abilities I'd have scratched you a good one.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Things have been so serious here lately.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Yes. I sensed the play in you lad, but this can no longer be play. Tomorrow we leave for Arrakis! Arrakis is real. The Harkonnens are real.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Dr. Yueh, do you have any information on the worms of Arrakis? -- DR. YUEH I have obtained a filmbook on a small specimen... only 125 meters long.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Only?!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: The storms and the worms. Is it true, that the sand can blow at seven hundred kilometers per hour?

Speaker: yueh
Dialogue: It can render flesh to dust in minutes. And these dry winds can generate tremendous static electricity in the atmosphere. Our body shields won't have enough power to operate in the open air on Arrakis.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Well, how do the Fremen survive there?

Speaker: yueh
Dialogue: We don't know much about the Fremen... They live in the deep desert... some of them in the cities and they have blue- within-blue eyes...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: The eyes -- yes, yes... saturation of the blood by the spice -- melange. Could the spice affect us in other ways?

Speaker: thufir
Dialogue: Many dangers exist on Arrakis. For one, we know the Harkonnens would not have given up their CHOAM company contract so easily.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: The Harkonnens are our enemies, yes... but behind them, I suspect, is the Emperor. -- THUFIR You will make a formidable Duke!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I know.  But if it is a trap then why are we going?

Speaker: thufir
Dialogue: We have our new army.  Dr. Yueh, put the weirding module on him.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Precise control....

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: The bull that killed my grandfather... is this an evil omen?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Duncan!

Speaker: duncan
Dialogue: Paul.  I was on my way to say goodbye to you.  I have to go on ahead.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Why?  I wish you were coming with us.

Speaker: duncan
Dialogue: It's something for your father.  He wants to talk to you.  I'll see you in Arrakis.  May the hand of God be with you.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: May the hand of God be with us all, Duncan.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Father.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Thank you for joining me, Paul.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I want you to be proud of me.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: I'll miss the sea... but a person needs new experiences... they jar something deep inside, allowing him to grow.  Without change, something sleeps inside us... and seldom awakens... The sleeper must awaken.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: The second moon, your moon...

Speaker: beautiful girl
Dialogue: Tell me of your homeworld, Usul.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: I  know she has come to test him... no man has ever been tested with the box... only Bene Gesserit women. I may lose my son.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Arrakis... Dune... Desert planet... moving... moving.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: We'll salvage what we can... but I can tell you.. dear God... for the father... nothing.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: My greatest student... and my greatest disappointment.... He's awake!... He's listening to us.  Good... Ready yourself, young Paul Atreides... I want to see you in your mother's chamber in one quarter of an hour.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Paul?... This is very important...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Kwisatz Haderach?... For the father... nothing?

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: It meant so much to him...

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: You thought only of a Duke's desire for a son?... Desires don't figure in this! An Atreides daughter could have been wed to a Harkonnen heir and sealed the breach. We may lose both blood lines now.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: I vowed never to regret my decision. I'll pay for my own mistakes.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: And your son will pay with you.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Paul, this is the Reverend Mother Gaius Helen Mohiam. She is going to... observe you...  Please... -- REVEREND MOTHER Jessica, you know it must be done. I enjoin you to stand guard at the door and practice the meditation of peace.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Your Reverence.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What about my Father?

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Paul... please, Paul... listen to the Reverend Mother and do what she tells you.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Now you come here.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Come here.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Pain.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: The Voice again.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: I hold at your neck the gom jabbar. Don't pull away or you'll feel that poison. A Duke's son must know about many poisons -- this one kills only animals.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Are you suggesting a Duke's son is an animal?

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Let us say I suggest you may be human. Your awareness may be powerful enough to control your instincts. Your instincts will be to remove your hand from the box. If you do so you will die. You will feel an itching -- there... see? Now the itching becomes burning... heat, upon heat, upon heat.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: It burns.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: SILENCE... SILENCE.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear... I will permit it to pass over me and through me. -- The Reverend Mother moves her face up to his. Her ancient face with its metal teeth gleaming inches away breathes hotly. She is smiling.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: You feel the flesh crisping?

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Flesh dropping off.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: THE PAIN!

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: NO!! ENOUGH!! Kull wahad! No woman child ever withstood that much. I must have wanted you to fail. Take your hand out of the box and look at it, young human.... Do it!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I see the truth of it. -- REVEREND MOTHER  You know when people speak the truth?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I know it.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Your mother wants you to tell me about your dreams. I only want to know one thing.... Do they come true?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Not all of them... I know which ones will.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Perhaps you are the Kwisatz Haderach.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: The person who can be many places at once... the one who bridges space and time.... He will look where we cannot.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Do you know of the Water of Life?... the Truthsayer drug?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I have heard of it. -- REVEREND MOTHER It is very dangerous... very painful. The Bene Gesserit sisterhood drink it to see within.... There is a place terrifying to us... to women. It is said a man will come... the Kwisatz Haderach... he will go where we cannot... Many men have tried...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Did they try and fail?

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: They tried and died....  Jessica!

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: I sense your teachings in him. Ignore the regular order of training. His safety requires The Voice.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I've heard enough of my safety... What about my father?... I heard you talking. You speak as if he was dead. Well, he isn't!

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Paul!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Well he isn't... and he won't die... Tell me he won't die!

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: What can be done has been done.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: MOTHER! Tell me!

Speaker: piter
Dialogue: It is by will alone I set my mind in motion. It is by the juice of Sapho that thoughts acquire speed - The lips acquire stains - The stains become a warning - It is by will alone I set my mind in motion.

Speaker: piter
Dialogue: My Lord!

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: Piter.

Speaker: piter
Dialogue: The Atreides will be leaving Caladan soon, Baron, and I have here your answer from Duke Leto.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: What does Leto say, Piter?

Speaker: piter
Dialogue: He wishes to inform you that Vendetta -- as he puts it, using the ancient tongue, the art of Kanly -- is still alive. He does not wish to meet or speak with you.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: I made my peace gesture... the forms of Kanly have been obeyed.

Speaker: piter
Dialogue: As you instructed me, I have enlightened your nephews concerning my plan t... -- BARON My plan!

Speaker: piter
Dialogue: The plan to crush the Atreides.  Feyd, Rabban... go quietly... no other great house of the Landsraad must ever know of the Emperor's aid to the Baron.  The entire Landsraad would turn against the Baron and the Emperor.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Put the pick in there Pete And turn it round real neat.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: You're so beautiful my Baron Your skin, love to me Your diseases lovingly cared for For all eternity.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: I will have Arrakis back for myself... he who controls the Spice, controls the universe... and what Piter didn't tell you is we have control of someone who is very close to Duke Leto.  This person... this traitor... will be worth more to us than ten legions of Sardaukar.

Speaker: feyd
Dialogue: Who is the traitor?

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: I won't tell you who the traitor is or when we'll attack.  However, the Duke will die before these eyes and he'll know that it is I -- Baron Vladimir Harkonnen -- who encompasses his doom. -- The Baron gives a hand signal and seven gates in the wall open, emitting tremendous SOUNDS.  Suddenly the Baron begins to float straight up, twenty-five feet in the air.  It is a frightening sight.  He floats down under the giant, humming electrical tube light and rubs his head and body with a black fluid which drips from tiny holes in either side of the pink glow.  Feyd and Rabban watch nervously.  The Attendants stand completely still with fear.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: I must not fear.  Fear is the mind- killer... the little death that brings total obliteration...

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Soon they'll begin to fold space.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Far off in the control rooms.... Travelling without moving.

Speaker: atreides technician
Dialogue: Harkonnens.

Speaker: thufir
Dialogue: Why isn't the shield up yet?

Speaker: thufir
Dialogue: We found these sabotage devices too easily...

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: So many reminders of the scarcity of water.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: The way you say Harkonnen... I didn't know you had so much reason to hate them.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Spice...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: A Fremen... Could she be the operator? No...

Speaker: shadout mapes
Dialogue: I must cleanse the way between us.... You saved my life... and we  Fremen pay our debts. It's known to us that you've a traitor in your midst. Who it is we cannot say but we're certain of it.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: A traitor...

Speaker: thufir
Dialogue: Set up a sonar probe immediately!

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: ...and a traitor... God help us.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: ...Gurney! We desperately need more spice miners... many are threatening to leave on the next shuttle. We need spice drivers, weather scanners, dune men ... any with open sand experience. You must persuade them to enlist with us. -- GURNEY They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup as the east wind. And they shall gather the captivity of the sand.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Very moving, Gurney. On your way... and take care of Dr. Kynes until Paul and I arrive. We will not be prisoners here in this place.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Behold as a wild ass in the desert go I forth to my work.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: I must speak with you Leto! --

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: shadout mapes
Dialogue: I am the Shadout Mapes, your housekeeper, Noble Born. What are your orders.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: You may refer to me as "my lady." I am not noble born. I'm the bound concubine of Duke Leto -- mother of the heir designate.... "Shadout"... that's an ancient word.

Speaker: mapes
Dialogue: You know the ancient tongues?

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: I know the Bhotani Jib and Chakobsa, all the hunting languages.

Speaker: mapes
Dialogue: As the legend says.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: I know the Dark things and the way of the Great Mother. Miseces prejin.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: And the means of my death should I prove otherwise.  Now we will see which way the decision tips.

Speaker: mapes
Dialogue: Do you know this my lady?

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: It's a crysknife.

Speaker: mapes
Dialogue: Say it not lightly...  Do you know its meaning?

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: It's a maker...

Speaker: mapes
Dialogue: My lady, when one has lived with prophecy for so long, the moment of revelation is a shock.

Speaker: mapes
Dialogue: Take the water of my life!

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: So, this is Leto the Just...

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: I hope I made myself clear. You may call him "The Duke," "My lord," or "Sire." And there is a more ancient term you might keep in mind -- "Noble Born."

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Play out your little comedy while you can off-worlders...

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: So you are Dr. Kynes, the Imperial Ecologist?

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: I prefer the more ancient term, planetologist... Noble Born.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: This is my son, Paul.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Are you a Fremen?

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: I am a servant of the His Majesty the Emperor. I have served His Majesty on Arrakis long enough for my eyes to change.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: He's hiding something.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: I understand we have you to thank for these stillsuits, Doctor.

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: They are Fremen suits. I hope they fit well, my lord.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: "Your gift is a blessing of the river."

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Most of the desert natives here are a superstitious lot. They mean no harm. With your permission, I will check the security of your suits.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: The Duke is to be addresses as... -- Kynes comes forward and adjusts the Duke's suit, checking seals and pulling on straps.

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Basically...

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Sire!

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: It's all right Gurney.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Yes, Sire.

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: It's a high-efficiency filter and heat exchange system. Perspiration passes through the first layer and is gathered in the second. The salt is separated. Breathing and walking provide the pumping action. The reclaimed water circulates to catchpockets from which you can drink through this tube at your neck. Urine and feces are processed in the thigh pads. Should you be in the open desert, remember to breathe in through your mouth, out through the nose tubes.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: My thanks.

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: With your permission...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Your suit is fitted desert fashion. Who told you how to do that?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: No one. It... seemed the proper way.

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: That it is.  He shall know your ways as if born to them.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: We're wasting time, Sire.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: I must speak with you Leto!

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Southeast over the Shield Wall. That's where I told your sandmaster to concentrate his harvesting.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Will we see a worm?

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Where there is spice and spice mining there are always worms.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Always?

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Always.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Why do they come?

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: To protect their territory. Vibrations attract them. -- PAUL  Is there a relationship between the worms and the spice?

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: The young master is a trained Mentat, an advanced student of Prana Bindu has studied under some of the finest teachers in the Universe.

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: As I said... they defend the spice sands. As to their relationship with the spice... who knows.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Dust cloud ahead, Sire.

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: That's it... spice mining... no other cloud quite like it. See the spotters over it? They're watching for wormsign... the telltale sand waves. Seismic probes on the surface, too Sire... worms can travel too deep for their waves to show... Looks like a good patch of spice.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Wormsign? Is it wormsign? -- KYNES Yes!... worm. Big one! You've got sharp eyes Sire.... May I?

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Calling Harvester Pad Nine. Wormsign!

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Who calls Pad Nine?

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Don't mention the Duke... This is an uncoded channel.

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Unlisted flight northeast of you... wormsign on intercept course... estimated contact fifteen minutes.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Have sighting confirmed. Stand by for fix. Contact in sixteen minutes minus. Very precise estimate. Who is on that unlisted flight?

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: What happens now?

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: The carryall will come and lift off the spice harvester. Try and get in close over the harvester... you'll find this interesting Sire. -- The Duke accelerates the ornithopter in the direction of the harvester. Paul can SEE...

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: They'll work until the very last minute.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Spotter control... no sign of the carryall... it isn't answering.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: The worm is eight minutes away, Sire.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Spotter control -- give me a report by the numbers.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Damn it... Harkonnens.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Duke Leto Atreides....

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Yes... yes, Sire!

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: How many men do you have?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Full crew -- twenty-six men -- but Sire, we can't leave this spice...

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Damn the spice! Get out of there.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Two men in each of the spotters... You!... over here... run!!

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Damn sloppy -- really damn sloppy.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Come on boys... come on.  We're going to be heavy, Sire.

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Here he is... We've got to go.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Spice!... pure un-refined spice!

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Bless the Maker and his water... Bless the coming and going of him.  May his passage cleanse the world.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: What's that you're saying?

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Liet?

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: You are about to witness something few have seen -- watch!  Watch!

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Gods, what a monster.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Someone is going to pay for this... I promise.

Speaker: kynes
Dialogue: This Duke is more concerned over his men than the spice!  I must admit... against all better judgement... I like this Duke.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Duncan!  What have you discovered about the Fremen, Duncan -- tell me.  Why haven't we heard from you?

Speaker: duncan
Dialogue: My lord... I suspect so much.  I think they are the allies we seek... they are strong and fierce... they do not give their loyalty easily or quickly....  As you know, the Imperium has never been able to take a census of the Fremen.  Everyone thinks that there are but few -- wandering here and there in the desert.... My lord, I suspect an incredible secret has been kept on this planet... that the Fremen exist in vast numbers... vast numbers... and it is they that control Arrakis.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Sleep well... my son.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Father!... father... drugged... --

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: What happened?  What?  The shield!

Speaker: yueh
Dialogue: I've brought House Atreides down.  I've destroyed the new army's weirding modules.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: ... Why?

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Refuse...

Speaker: yueh
Dialogue: No! -- You mustn't... for in return I will save the lives of your Paul and Jessica.

Speaker: atreides guard
Dialogue: The shield!  The shield!

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: LONG LIVE DUKE LETO!

Speaker: troopers
Dialogue: Long live Duke Leto!

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Leto... where are you?

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: Goodbye, Jessica and goodbye to your sweet son....  I want to spit once on your head... just some spittle on your face -- what a luxury.

Speaker: nefud
Dialogue: What are your orders, Piter?

Speaker: piter
Dialogue: Take them to the desert, as the traitor suggested and worms will destroy the evidence.  Their bodies must never be found. --

Speaker: piter
Dialogue: I'd thought of many pleasures with you. It is perhaps better that you die in the innards of a worm.  Desire clouds my reason....  That is not good... that is bad.

Speaker: duncan
Dialogue: They're on this floor somewhere....

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Duncan!!  Duncan!!

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: You wish now to join your wife, is that it, traitor?

Speaker: yueh
Dialogue: She lives?

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: You wish to join her... join her, then.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: Take him away.

Speaker: rabban
Dialogue: He was in the Palace with the Atreides... I also say he was a spy for the Emperor.  Go now!  Take him to his desert to die. Go!

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Yueh's sign.  He's left a satchell.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Don't touch my mother...

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Oh great mother!  He's trying the voice. The Reverend Mother said it could save him.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: The calming exercise.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Remove her gag!

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Excellent!

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: First cut my son's bonds. -- Guard #1 slowly cuts Paul's big straps, never taking his eyes off Jessica.  The ornithopter gets closer and closer to the top jagged surface of the Shield Wall.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Oh, my God!

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: Duke Leto Atreides.  Someone's torn the insignia off your uniform.  Such carelessness.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: It was Feyd?  It was Feyd!  Where is the ducal signet ring?  I must have his ring.

Speaker: piter
Dialogue: The ring?... he was brought to us as is, Baron.  I...

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: You killed the doctor too soon, you fool!

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Yueh... Yueh... dead... Paul and Jessica safe... the tooth!

Speaker: piter
Dialogue: He's coming round, my Lord.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Wait... he must be near...

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: Where is your ring?

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: A... little... closer....  The... water... of my life... for Paul.

Speaker: duke leto
Dialogue: Now!

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Leto!  Leto!

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: I'm alive!!!  I'm alive!!!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I can't maintain any altitude... we'll never reach the safety of rock.  Maybe that small rock.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Where are we do you think?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: The South Polar regions... the forbidden area.  We must make it to that rock...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Hurry!

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Bring these satchels!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Hurry -- This crashing may bring a worm.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: A million deaths are not enough for Yueh...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Where are my feelings... I feel for no one...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Listen to me!... you wanted to know about my dreams... and I've just had a waking dream... do you know why?... -- JESSICA Calm yourself/

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: The spice!  It's in everything here.  The air, the soil, the food...  It's like the Truthsayer drug.....  It's a poison!!!! You knew the spice would change me.  But thanks to your teachings it's changed my consciousness.  I can see it... I can see it.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Is he....?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: You carry my unborn sister in your womb!

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: He knows.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: You and your Bene Gesserit sisterhood... I'm not your Kwisatz Haderach...  I'm something different, something unexpected!  I am so much more...  You don't begin to know me...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Father!

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: Rabban, Rabban...  I place you in charge of Arrakis.  It's yours to squeeze, as I promised.  I want you to squeeze and squeeze and squeeze.  Go....  Show no mercy!

Speaker: rabban
Dialogue: Yes, my lord Baron.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Yueh's left the plans for the weirding modules.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: We have to get to that mountain of rock. We have entered the time when all will turn against us and seek our lives...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Remember... walk without rhythm and we won't attract a worm... it'll go to the thumper.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: I'm ready.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Keep going...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Faster!! -- JESSICA  It's deafening!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Run!

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: I can't... I can't.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Drum sand!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Do you smell it?

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I know the secret.  The worm is the spice... the spice is the worm.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Paul!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: A thumper.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Someone started another thumper....  We're not alone.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Man-carved steps.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Yes...

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: Perhaps these are the ones Mapes told us of.

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: Are you trained in the ways of the desert?

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: No, but many consider my training valuable.

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: I will take the boy-man... he shall have sanctuary in my tribe... -- A LOW NOTE on a dip stick is blown by one of the Fremen tribe.  Jessica shifts, Paul sees it, and just as Stilgar begins a reach for his weapon, Jessica turns, slashes out, utters a SOUND, whirls again and with rock behind her holds Stilgar helpless in front of her -- her hand at his throat. Paul moves on her first move.  He races up a rocky incline.

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: Stop!  Get back!!  She has the weirding way.  Why didn't you tell us!  Great gods... if you can do this to the strongest of us you're worth ten times your weight of water.  As a leader of my people I give you my bond: teach us this weirding way and you both shall have sanctuary.  Your water shall mingle with our water.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Then I will teach you our way of battle....  you have the word bond of a Bene Gesserit.

Speaker: a fremen
Dialogue: It is the legend.

Speaker: chani
Dialogue: I am Chani, daughter of Liet....  I would not have permitted you to harm my tribe.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: From my dream... so beautiful.  Liet.... is this Kynes' daughter?

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: You have strength... real strength... You shall be known as Usul, which is the strength of the base of the pillar.  This is your secret name in our troop.  But you must choose the name of manhood which we will call you openly.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What do you call the mouse shadow in the second moon?

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: We call that one Muad'dib.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Could I be known as Paul Muad'dib?

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: You are Paul Muad'dib, and your mother shall be a Sayyadina among us....  We welcome you.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Moisture...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Wind traps... huge ones.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: A treasure.

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: Greater than treasure, Usul.  We have thousands of such caches.  Only a few of us know them all.  When we have enough... we shall change the face of Arrakis. Listen!...

Speaker: monk
Dialogue: We sense that you may be the "voice from the outer world".  Both moons told us of you.  You must pass tests before we will know... you must conquer the beast of the desert, both his outer and his deadly inner powers.  Speak to us... from the outer world.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Muad'dib!

Speaker: monk
Dialogue: The legend.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Our shared enemy the Harkonnens, are once again in control of Arrakis.  Stilgar, your leader, has asked me and my mother to crush the Harkonnens.  We must do more than this.  We must totally destroy all spice production on Arrakis.  The Guild and the entire universe depends on spice.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: The weirding way has long been a Bene Gesserit secret.  With my mother's help, my father isolated an element of the weirding way and externalised it. -- PAUL  Because of the Harkonnen treachery, my father's armies were never able to fully develop this new form.  This is what I will teach you.  You will be the fiercest and most feared fighters in the Universe.

Speaker: orato
Dialogue: Break!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Move back!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Chuksa!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: To avenge my father, I will turn you into killing machines.

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: Sayyadina.  Our Reverend Mother tells me she is too old... She has been calling through space and time for you to come and let her rest.  She asks that you pass within.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: I will try to pass within.

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: Death may be the result....  Are you sure?

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: I must do this for Paul, but what of my unborn child?

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: Do you know the Water of Life?... Come... ...Watch... the mystery of mysteries... the end and the beginning.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: The most lethal poison in the Universe.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: ... Many men have tried.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Did they try and fail?

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: They tried and died.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: What if she should fail?

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: The ultimate awareness spectrum narcotic. I must transform the poison configuration within my body... the blue must be made clean.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: What is this?...  Is this what kills the men who enter here?

Speaker: monk
Dialogue: Change it that we may all drink of it. -- Jessica spews water into the spout.  The monk swirls the jug, sniffs at the spout and then drinks.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: She did it!

Speaker: chani
Dialogue: Come with me.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Chani....  I love you... I've always loved you.... --

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: Feyd, even though he's aging, Thufir is one of the finest Mentats in the Universe... and he's mine, Feyd... all mine....  Quiet now.

Speaker: feyd
Dialogue: I will.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: Oh Thufir, I see they've installed your heart plug already....  Don't be angry. Everyone gets one here.  But this is not why we're here.  We've brought you a little cat, Thufir.  You must care for it if you wish to live.  A poison has been introduced into you, Thufir Hawat.  By milking this smooth little cat body each day you receive your antidote... it must be done each day....  Also, you must do something for me if you wish to live.  You know I lost Piter, my dear Mentat...

Speaker: feyd
Dialogue: All I can see is an Atreides that I want to kill.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: Feyd, no, no!  Thufir's a Harkonnen now, aren't you Thufir?

Speaker: thufir
Dialogue: My dear Duke... how I have failed you. --

Speaker: harah
Dialogue: What will you call her?

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Alia.

Speaker: alia
Dialogue: Mother.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Activate your weirding modules...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Set the range for two meters.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Korba...  The arm...

Speaker: korba
Dialogue: Chuuk-sa...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Motion... Chuuk-sa...

Speaker: korba
Dialogue: Chuuuk-sa...

Speaker: a fremen
Dialogue: Muad'dib!...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: My own name is a killing word.  Will it be a healing word as well?

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: Usul... these are fifteen of our fiercest fighters to serve you as your guard... the Fedaykin.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Now! -- Stilgar signals, and Fremen run behind them.

Speaker: rabban
Dialogue: What happened?  What happened to you? What is he saying?

Speaker: wounded harkonnen
Dialogue: Muad'dib!...  Muad'dib!... Muad'dib!... Muad'dib!

Speaker: rabban
Dialogue: Who is this Muad'dib?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Only the very strong ones travel this deep....

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: Usul has called a big one.  Again... it is the legend.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: A sandrider!...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Long live the fighters!

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Seventeen Great Houses of the Lansraad have reported a significant delay in delivery of spice per CHOAM agreement. This constitutes a serious violation of CHOAM codes.  Contact Baron Vladimir Harkonnen immediately.

Speaker: rabban
Dialogue: Falsify the reports.  We can't hide it all, tell them we've lost only two hundred harvesters... and forty carryalls... and don't let my uncle know about the destruction of the spice silos....  I will catch this Muad'dib and suck the blood from him!!  SUCK THE BLOOD FROM HIM!!! --

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: We surprised a band of smugglers.

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: Too bad... thought they were Harkonnen.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Gurney!...

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Paul!!  Paul!!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Don't you trust your own eyes.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: They said you were dead.  They said...

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: You young pup!  You young pup! --

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Stand-by... warning... we have just received a coded threat from the Guild. Spice production is in serious jeopardy... Giedi Prime supplying false reports... Guild to visit Emperor in one standard day.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: What do you mean one last...

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: But he was said to...

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Who is this Paula Atreides to the Guild? And why?

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: It's the way she speaks of things...

Speaker: harah
Dialogue: But Your Reverence, they won't have her around them.

Speaker: alia
Dialogue: Would they deny me the right to use this voice?...

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Alia!

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: I want fifty legions of Sardaukar on Arrakis at once.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: This is genocide...  the deliberate and systematic destruction of all life on Arrakis.

Speaker: chani
Dialogue: You were calling my name... it frightened me. -- Page Missing -- In the hollow of a huge dune, Paul stops with Chani. They share a look into each other's eyes.  Paul turns towards the Fedaykin and nods.  They move in quickly to tie and wrap Paul in Fremen rope.  They move back and wait quietly.  Chani moves in very close to Paul.  She holds a glass vial of the blue water of life.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Hurry!  All I see is darkness.

Speaker: chani
Dialogue: Paul... I will love you forever... in life or in death... let Shai-Hulud judge now.  You are my life.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Now... the test of the water of life... what is it that waits for me in this darkness?

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: ALIA!

Speaker: alia
Dialogue: Mother - help me!

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Alia!  What is it? -- ALIA It's Paul.  He's taken the Water of Life.

Speaker: chani
Dialogue: Paul... Paul. 240B.     EXT. WAVE CRASHING

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Father!...  Father!  THE SLEEPER HAS AWAKENED.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Arrakis... Dune... Desert Planet.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Long live the fighters!

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: Long live the fighters!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Gurney, when the storm hits... set off the atomics.  I want an opening through the entire Shield Wall.  Stilgar?  Do we have wormsign?

Speaker: stilgar
Dialogue: Usul... We have wormsign, the likes of which even God has never seen.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Bring in that floating fat man... the Baron.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Why have you brought me here?

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: Your Highness... There must be some mistake... I never requested your presence.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Ah?  But your lack of action demanded it. Your dreadful mismanagement, your bad judgement in assigning to Rabban --  -- the governorship....  You forced me to come here and set things straight... personally. -- A VOICE Bring in the messenger.

Speaker: alia
Dialogue: I am the messenger from Muad'dib.  Poor Emperor, I'm afraid my brother won't be very pleased with you.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Silence!...  I do not court your brother's pleasure.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Get out of my mind!!!

Speaker: alia
Dialogue: Not until you tell them both who I really am.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Sister of Paul Muad'dib.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Paul's sister... Paul is Muad'dib?!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Alia keeps pace with the storm. -- Gurney and Stilgar don't understand.  Suddenly enormous dust clouds and LIGHTNING sweep up over the Shield Wall.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Gurney, now!

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Atomics!

Speaker: alia
Dialogue: My brother is coming... with many Fremen warriors.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Impossible!

Speaker: alia
Dialogue: Not impossible.  I told you... He is here now.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: Release the Sardaukar.  Baron... give this little abomination to the storm.

Speaker: baron
Dialogue: I have her, Majesty!

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: My Lord?

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Let him stand free!

Speaker: feyd
Dialogue: The antidote...

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: Thufir.  Come.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: I mean this, Thufir.  If you are to strike, do it now.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Carry this noble Atreides warrior away. Do him all honor.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Emperor Shadam the IV... there are Guild Heighliners above us containing many Great Houses of the Lansraad....  SEND THEM BACK!

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: How dare you speak to me...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Good.  You have some idea of what I would do but I will tell it to one who has never been seen... one who hides deep in the Heighliner control rooms.  He will hear it first.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: Stop him, Jessica!

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Stop him yourself.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: You saw a part of what the race needs in the beginning.  In time you perverted the truth.  You sought to control human breeding and intermix a select few according to a selfish master plan.  How little you understand.

Speaker: reverend mother
Dialogue: You mustn't speak of...

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: SILENCE!

Speaker: feyd
Dialogue: The righteous!

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: There is a Harkonnen among you.  Give the Harkonnen a blade and let him stand forth.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: If Feyd wishes, he can meet you with my blade in his hand.

Speaker: feyd
Dialogue: I wish it.

Speaker: gurney
Dialogue: This is a Harkonnen animal.  Let me, please, my Lord.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: The Emperor's blade.

Speaker: feyd
Dialogue: Why prolong the inevitable?  I will kill you!  I will kill him!

Speaker: chani
Dialogue: Paul!

Speaker: feyd
Dialogue: Who is the little one?  A pet, perhaps? Will she deserve my special attentions?

Speaker: feyd
Dialogue: You see... your death... my blade will finish you.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: Now, I will tell you how it will be. Irulan shall be my wife, opening the way for an Atreides to take the throne.

Speaker: emperor
Dialogue: I sit on the throne!! -- PAUL You will sit on a throne on Selusa Secundus, your prison planet.  Either that or you will die.

Speaker: jessica
Dialogue: Think on it Chani... We who carry the name of concubine... history will call us wives.

Speaker: paul
Dialogue: The Fremen have the word of Muad'dib. They will have their Holy War to cleanse the Universe... they will have Arrakis... Dune... their planet.  There will be flowing water here open to the sky and rich green oases.  For the spice there will always be some desert.  There will be fierce winds and trials to toughen men. We Fremen have a saying...  "God created Arrakis to train the faithful." One cannot go against the word of God.

Speaker: alia
Dialogue: And how can this be?
